pullsbody: These commands have been useful to us to create MacOS installation DMGs
pull_repo_desc: Portable libraries and utilities that manipulate HFS+ volumes and Apple's DMG images. This fork focuses on hfs extractall.

pull_commit_message:
Add the 'swapforks' command

This swaps the data fork and the resource fork of a given file.
It can be useful to populate the resource fork with data now that
Linux support is not available anymore.

pullsbody: These commands have been useful to us to create MacOS installation DMGs
pull_repo_desc: Portable libraries and utilities that manipulate HFS+ volumes and Apple's DMG images. This fork focuses on hfs extractall.

pulltitle: dmg: Allow to statically link against OpenSSL
pullsbody:
It turns out FindOpenSSL, which is included:
- respects the OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS to force the openssl libraries to
  be linked statically (and only those).
- provides variables for the individual libraries.

The latter means dmg/CMakeLists.txt doesn't actually need to search for
libcrypto on its own, but can just use whatever FindOpenSSL found, which
respects OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS.

Unfortunately, statically linking libcrypto requires linking against
libdl, so we also link CMAKE_DL_LIBS when OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS is set.
pull_repo_desc: Portable libraries and utilities that manipulate HFS+ volumes and Apple's DMG images. This fork focuses on hfs extractall.
pull_commit_message:
dmg: Allow to statically link against OpenSSL

It turns out FindOpenSSL, which is included:
- respects the OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS to force the openssl libraries to
  be linked statically (and only those).
- provides variables for the individual libraries.

The latter means dmg/CMakeLists.txt doesn't actually need to search for
libcrypto on its own, but can just use whatever FindOpenSSL found, which
respects OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS.

Unfortunately, statically linking libcrypto requires linking against
libdl, so we also link CMAKE_DL_LIBS when OPENSSL_USE_STATIC_LIBS is set.
